title: Insider
description: This is information about the insider involved in the incident. An incident can have multiple insiders.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "insider--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

incident_role.description: Whether the insider was the primary actor or had a different role in the incident

motive.description: The insider's motive(s) for the incident

substance_use_during_incident.description: Insider was using or abusing substance(s) at the time they took one or more actions related to the incident

psychological_issues.description: Psychological issue(s) the insider experienced during or before the incident

predispositions.description: Insider's tendency toward certain actions or qualities

concerning_behaviors.description: Insider's history of past behavior that could indicate future issues

oneOf.title: Primary
oneOf.description: Insider is the primary perpetrator of the incident

oneOf.title: Co-Conspirator
oneOf.description: Insider is a co-conspirator in the incident

oneOf.title: Looked the other way
oneOf.description: Insider looked the other way while the primary perpetrator conducted the incident

oneOf.title: Approved primary insider's actions
oneOf.description: Insider knowingly approved the primary perpetrator's actions, such as by signing off on a fraudulent invoice

oneOf.title: Benefit Foreign Entity
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack to benefit a foreign entity, such as a foreign government or military

oneOf.title: Benefit New Employer
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack to benefit their new employer, such as by stealing a client list when they left the victim organization

oneOf.title: Competitive Business Advantage
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack in order to gain a business advantage for a competing company. Often, this is the insider starting their own company

oneOf.title: Curiosity
oneOf.description: Insider committed the incident out of curiosity. E.g., Insider accessed medical records of a celebrity because they were curious of that celebrity's age

oneOf.title: Financial Gain
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack to make a profit

oneOf.title: Freedom of Information
oneOf.description: The insider held the belief that it is in the best interest of the public to share the victim organization's confidential information with the public (e.g., sharing unfavorable test results of a product or unfavorable information about an organization's internal practices)

oneOf.title: Recognition
oneOf.description: The insider wanted to be recognized (e.g., for being smart, talented, capable, powerful, etc.)

oneOf.title: Revenge
oneOf.description: The insider wanted revenge for an actual or perceived wrong

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other motive not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Outpatient Treatment
oneOf.description: Insider received treatment in which they were not hospitalized overnight, but rather visited a hospital, clinic, or associated facility for diagnosis or treatment

oneOf.title: Inpatient Treatment
oneOf.description: Insider received treatment that involved 24-hour (including overnight) supervision at a hospital or dedicated psychiatric facility

oneOf.title: Medication Noncompliance
oneOf.description: The insider stopped taking a prescribed medication or following a prescribed course of treatment for a particular medical or mental health condition which, in turn, could have impacted their mental faculties

oneOf.title: Delusions
oneOf.description: The insider experienced or acted on delusions at some point during their employment within the organization

oneOf.title: Threatened/Attempted Suicide
oneOf.description: Insider threatened or attempted to commit suicide at some point during their employment within the organization

oneOf.title: Depression/Anxiety
oneOf.description: Insider expressed issues with or was diagnosed with depression or anxiety

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Insider experienced specific psychological issues not specified in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Social and Mental Health Issues
oneOf.description: A history of behaviors related to the insider's mental health or unacceptable social behavior

oneOf.title: A History of Rule Violations
oneOf.description: A history of violating the law or violating rules at other organizations

oneOf.title: Suspicious Associations
oneOf.description: A history of associating with criminal or otherwise objectionable persons or entities

oneOf.title: Personal Stressful Events
oneOf.description: Events in the insider's personal life that could lead to additional stress or futher motivate the insider to harm their organization

oneOf.title: Possible Psychological Issues
oneOf.description: Possible or confirmed mental health condition or psychological problem (e.g., the insider shared they were feeling depressed)

oneOf.title: Diagnosed Psychological Issues
oneOf.description: Insider is diagnosed with a mental health problem (e.g., the insider put on medication for depression and antipsychotics)

oneOf.title: Gambling Problems
oneOf.description: Gambling activity that negatively affects other areas of their life (e.g., the insider frequently spends multiple hours at the casino every week)

oneOf.title: Substance Abuse
oneOf.description: A history of alcohol or drugs, either previous or ongoing (e.g., the insider showed up to work intoxicated)

oneOf.title: A History Of Financial Problems
oneOf.description: Existing financial issues, including medical bills for family members (e.g., the insider had previously filed for bankruptcy)

oneOf.title: Poor Hygiene
oneOf.description: Insider had poor general hygiene

oneOf.title: Risk Taker
oneOf.description: Insider was referred to by co-workers, supervisors, or friends as a reckless or risk-taking individual

oneOf.title: Previous Arrest/Conviction For Related Crime
oneOf.description: Involvement or conviction in a previous crime which is similar in nature to the current case (e.g., the insider executed similar fraud six years earlier. Misdemeanor conviction for the same conduct with probation sentence)

oneOf.title: Previous Arrest/Conviction for Unrelated Crime
oneOf.description: Involvement in a previous crime which is unrelated to the current case (e.g., the insider was previously arrested for assault)

oneOf.title: Previous Perpetrator of Domestic Violence
oneOf.description: Previously convicted or charged on a crime involving domestic violence (e.g., the insider was previously arrested for abusing spouse)

oneOf.title: Hacking Related Activities
oneOf.description: Involvement in activities focused on obtaining unauthorized access to or otherwise harming IT systems (e.g., the insider often discussed their hacking related activities on their website)

oneOf.title: Previous Attempts to Disclose Through Illegitimate Means
oneOf.description: Disclosing or attempting to disclose information through illegitimate means (i.e., not legally protected as a whistleblower)

oneOf.title: Pending or Previous Defendant in Civil Action
oneOf.description: The insider was previously found liable in a civil action outside of the specific incident (i.e. where a insider was sued previously, which may be a motivation for the insider's actions)

oneOf.title: Previous use of illegal substances
oneOf.description: Known use of illegal narcotics or illegal use of prescribed medications

oneOf.title: Criminal Association
oneOf.description: Insider associates with known criminals or criminal organizations

oneOf.title: Internet Underground Association
oneOf.description: Insider associates with or participates in darkweb groups or activities

oneOf.title: Medical Problems
oneOf.description: Health issues experienced by anyone involved in the event since the insider's hire date (e.g., the insider contracted lupus and was put on medication)

oneOf.title: Relationship Problems
oneOf.description: A problem in one of the insider's relationships that affects the insider, including family and romantic relationships developed after the insider's hire date (e.g., the insider was going through a divorce)

oneOf.title: Emerging Financial Problems
oneOf.description: Monetary issues experienced by or relevant to the insider (including medical bills for family members) known to have developed after the insider's hire date (e.g., the insider claimed they stole from the organization in order to pay for their child's education)

oneOf.title: Family Health Issues
oneOf.description: Someone in the insider's family, or otherwise close to the insider, has health or medical issues

oneOf.title: Misuse of Company Resources
oneOf.description: Using or abusing company resources in an unauthorized manner

oneOf.title: Technical Policy Abuse
oneOf.description: Violating policies regarding the use of the organization's IT systems

oneOf.title: Interpersonal Issues
oneOf.description: Conflicts with others in the organization or human resources (HR) issues

oneOf.title: Financial
oneOf.description: Financial conflicts of interest or significant changes to financial status

oneOf.title: Organizational Conflict
oneOf.description: Competitive conflicts of interest with the organization

oneOf.title: Suspicious Contact
oneOf.description: Suspicious communication with or travel to entities, areas, or individuals that present a conflict of interest with the organization

oneOf.title: Relocation
oneOf.description: Physical relocation

oneOf.title: Theft Of Physical Company Property
oneOf.description: Stealing their employer's physical property (e.g., the insider reported a company laptop as stolen, but had it when they were arrested)

oneOf.title: Insider Expressed Ownership Of Work
oneOf.description: Acting as if they had personal right to any work done for the organization, despite knowledge of organizational right to employee work (e.g., the insider refused to return copy of code that they wrote because they felt entitled to it)

oneOf.title: Repeated Security Violations - Non-Technical
oneOf.description: Violating organizational security policies not related to IT systems (e.g., the insider broke into the school on multiple occasions and was also caught cheating)

oneOf.title: Other Unauthorized Software Acquisition
oneOf.description: Acquiring any sort of unauthorized software on an organizational system (e.g., the insider downloaded a password recovery tool from a website)

oneOf.title: Repeated Security Violations - Technical
oneOf.description: Multiple instances of security violations related to organizational IT systems (e.g., the insider repeatedly let co-workers use their workstation)

oneOf.title: Unauthorized Download - Remotely
oneOf.description: Unapproved download from offsite (e.g., the insider logged into their company account from home on their personal laptop and downloaded torrents)

oneOf.title: Unauthorized Download - On Site
oneOf.description: Unapproved download from within the organization (e.g., the insider used their company-issued workstation to download torrents)

oneOf.title: IP Policy Violation
oneOf.description: Violating any of the policies put in place by the company regarding their IP (i.e. trade secrets, patents, copyright, etc.)

oneOf.title: Violation of Need to Know
oneOf.description: Accessing organizational information which is not needed for their work, as defined by organizational policy

oneOf.title: Employee Extortion, Threats, or Legal Demands
oneOf.description: Extortion, threats (physical, technical, legal, etc.) or legal demands against the organization (e.g., the insider threatened to sue company unless they agreed to the terms of their demands)

oneOf.title: Conflict With Supervisor
oneOf.description: Personal or work-related disputes with their supervisor (e.g., the insider was unhappy with their new boss because the boss modified the organization's bonus system)

oneOf.title: Conflict With Coworker(s)
oneOf.description: Personal or work-related disputes with a coworker (e.g., the insider yelled at a coworker for repeatedly parking in their spot)

oneOf.title: Work Attendance Problems
oneOf.description: Being late for work or having unexcused/unplanned absences from work, generally multiple times (e.g., the insider reports late to work 7 times during the month of April)

oneOf.title: Human Resource Policy Violations or Complaints
oneOf.description: Violating the organization's human resource policy or making a formal complaint about something/someone within the organization (e.g., the insider made several complaints to management about their co-worker's noise level)

oneOf.title: Disgruntled Employee
oneOf.description: One who is upset with the organization and desires to get a measure of revenge against the organization (e.g., the insider grew disgruntled because of losing their 'star' status at the organization as it grew larger)

oneOf.title: Bragging
oneOf.description: The insider boasts about a concerning behavior to co-workers or online (e.g., the insider boasted about being able to shut down the organization's system anytime they wanted)

oneOf.title: Concurrent Crimes
oneOf.description: The insider commits a second illegal action while committing the unrelated illegal insider incident (e.g., the insider was indicted for domestic abuse while committing the insider incident)

oneOf.title: Formal Complaint
oneOf.description: Organization receives complaints about the insider from a coworker which were officially documented

oneOf.title: Informal Complaint
oneOf.description: Organization receives complaints about the insider from a coworker which were not officially documented

oneOf.title: Insubordination
oneOf.description: Defiance or refusal to follow commands or instructions

oneOf.title: Physical Abuse/Harassment
oneOf.description: Engaging in any type of physical abuse and/or harassment against another employee

oneOf.title: Sexual Harassment
oneOf.description: Engaging in any type of sexual harassment against another employee

oneOf.title: Unexplained Wealth
oneOf.description: A sudden increase in the amount of money the insider appears to have (e.g., the insider purchased $400,000 in personal items even though their annual salary was $50,000)

oneOf.title: Employee Forms New Competing Business
oneOf.description: Maintains a financial stake in another business or scheme that conflicts with their present employer (e.g., the insider invests in stocks of the victim organization's competitor)

oneOf.title: Financial Conflict of Interest
oneOf.description: Starting a business in the same area as their previous employer (e.g., the insider left one law firm to start their own law firm)

oneOf.title: Planning/Contact with Competing Organization
oneOf.description: Conspiring with a competitor of the current employer in any way (e.g., the insider e-mailed a competing organization detailing plans to steal trade secrets)

oneOf.title: Employee Went To Work For A Competing Organization
oneOf.description: Leaving their current employer and joining a competing organization. E.g., Insider accepted a position at a competing technical firm before resigning from their current position.

oneOf.title: Employee Sought Other Employment
oneOf.description: Seeking another job while still employed with their current employer (e.g., the insider sent their resume to another organization)

oneOf.title: Group Resignation
oneOf.description: Two or more employees leave the organization at approximately the same time for similar reasons (e.g., all five insiders resigned simultaneously, then went to work for a competitor)

oneOf.title: Insider Creates Legal Entity for Illegitimate Purpose
oneOf.description: Creates a legal entity in order to move forward with scheme or to hide assets as a result of the scheme (e.g., the insider creates a shell company to protect assets)

oneOf.title: Falsified Background Information
oneOf.description: Lies about or otherwise manipulates information about their background: personal or financial history, contacts, groups, etc.

oneOf.title: Suspicious Foreign Contact
oneOf.description: Tie(s) to foreign nation(s) such as company or independent travel, family members, telephone records, etc. (e.g., the insider consistently calls former co-worker who now works in a non-allied country)

oneOf.title: Suspicious Foreign Travel
oneOf.description: Traveling to foreign nations that, if the travel was known, should raise concerns with the organization

oneOf.title: Foreign Travel - Work Related
oneOf.description: Travel undertaken by the insider as required for their job (e.g., the insider's job required frequent travel to non-allied countries)

oneOf.title: Planning/Contact with Conspirator
oneOf.description: Conspiring with a conspirator in order to begin or further their particular scheme (e.g., the insider calls their partner-in-crime in order to establish attack details)

oneOf.title: Geographic Relocation
oneOf.description: Permanent move to a new physical location
